p: Luteibacter strain 328 showed by far the most active cell wall-associated enzymatic fraction. Except for Luteibacter, chitinase activity was highest in Bradyrhizobium strains, Variovorax strains, and Pseudomonas strains. Strains of Pseudomonas, Variovorax, and Luteibacter were not able to grow on CMC medium but displayed cellobiohydrolase and Î²-glucosidase activities suitable for the degradation of cellulose-derived oligosaccharides ( Table 1; Supplementary Figure 3).
